articles.description: Lauren James produces a sensational performance as England sweep aside China and book their place in the last 16 of the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Stunning James helps England power into last 16

articles.description: Trent Rockets start their title defence with a thrilling six-run win over Southern Brave in the opening game of The Hundred men's competition.
articles.title: Rockets beat Brave in thriller to begin men's Hundred

articles.description: England produce their best performance of the Netball World Cup so far to beat Fiji and confirm their place in the semi-finals.
articles.title: England dominate Fiji to reach World Cup semi-finals

articles.description: Chelsea complete the signing of teenage French midfielder Lesley Ugochukwu from Rennes on a seven-year deal for 27m euros (£23.2m).
articles.title: Chelsea sign teenager Ugochukwu on seven-year deal

articles.description: England were the better side in the Ashes but now face a period of regeneration, says BBC cricket correspondent Jonathan Agnew.
articles.title: England look ahead after having better of Ashes - Agnew

articles.description: Watch the best shots from the opening day of The Hundred 2023, featuring Sam Hain, Anya Shrubsole and Smriti Mandhana.
articles.title: Hain makes the reverse scoop six his own

articles.description: Two-time Hundred finalists Southern Brave start their campaign with a dominant 27-run win over Trent Rockets.
articles.title: Brave thrash Rockets in women's Hundred opener

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says it is "not helpful" that the transfer window in Saudi Arabia is open for significantly longer than in Europe.
articles.title: Saudi window closing after Europe not helpful - Klopp

articles.description: France, Jamaica, Italy and Brazil are among those bidding to clinch last-16 spots at the Women's World Cup on Wednesday.
articles.title: France, Brazil and Jamaica bid for last-16 spots

articles.description: Watch the best plays from day five of the Netball World Cup, including a "sneaky pass" from Scotland's Iona Christian.
articles.title: Scotland's 'sneaky pass' stars in World Cup plays of the day
